did.abstract: Detroit, Michigan, dentist and leader in public health dentistry; director of the Dental Division of the Children's Fund of Michigan (1929-1948), director of the Child Health division of the Children's Fund (1948-1954), and administrator of the Northern and Central Michigan Children’s Clinics. Correspondence, reports, budgets, questionnaires, inventories, and form books concerning dental programs of the Children’s Fund; lectures and articles on dental practice and education; also photographs.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Mrs. Kenneth Gibson (donor no. 4068) and came to the library in August 1963.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records are not expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Kenneth Richard Gibson papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Kenneth Richard Gibson was born December 12, 1895, in Dunbar, Wisconsin. He graduated from the University of Michigan School of Dentistry in 1918, and earned his master's degree in public health in 1938. Between 1943 and 1946, he pursued additional graduate coursework at the School of Public Health. In 1921, he was appointed director of the Bureau of Dentistry and Oral Hygiene of the Michigan Department of Health. He served for three years until 1924, when he returned to private practice.

In 1929, Gibson was named director of the Dental Division of the Children's Fund of Michigan, a charitable fund established by Senator James Couzens for the care of indigent children in the state. Gibson served in this capacity until 1948. From 1948 to 1954, Gibson served as the director of the Child Health Division of the Fund. In addition, Gibson was administrator of the Northern Michigan Children's Clinic at Marquette and the Central Michigan Children's Clinic at Traverse City, and oversaw the Fund's eye program from 1948 until the mid 1950s.

Gibson served as director of the Michigan Association of Public Health, Dentists and Dental Hygienists, president of the School Health Association, president of the Michigan Public Health Association, and president of the Michigan State Society for the Promotion of Children's Dentistry. He died December 15, 1959.

scopecontent.p: The Kenneth Richard Gibson papers document his work as director of the Dental Division of the Children's Fund of Michigan and director of the Child Health Division of the Fund; his work with a number of public health and dental health professional associations; and to a lesser extent, his coursework in public health. The papers are arranged into four series: Personal, Professional Associations, Children's Fund of Michigan, Dental Division, and Children's Fund of Michigan, Child Health Division.

controlaccess.head: Subjects - Visual Materials:
controlaccess.subject: Dentistry--Michigan.
Public health--Michigan.
Schools--Michigan--Bay County.
controlaccess.corpname: University of Michigan. College of Dental Surgery. Class of 1918.

scopecontent.p: The bulk of the Personal series consists of Gibson's notes, essays, and bibliographies from his coursework in public health at the University of Michigan, from 1934 to 1946. The series also contains clippings about Gibson's career, and several photographs, including images of dental education presentations and displays, a 29th reunion photo of the University of Michigan Dental School class of 1918, and a picture of Dr. Gibson receiving a citation.

did.unittitle: Essays on public health and health sector labor market 1943-1946

odd.p: (includes group photo of 29th reunion of U of M Dental School class of 1918)

scopecontent.p: The Professional Associations series documents Gibson's work with regional and national dental health, public health, and school health associations. Records include correspondence, minutes, and reports from the American School Health Association, the Michigan School Health Association, the Michigan Public Health Association, the Michigan Health Officers Association, the American Association of Orthodontics, and the American College of Dentists.

did.unittitle: American Association of Orthodontics, Public Relations Bureau 1941-1942
American College of Dentists, Committee on Public Relations 1956
American and Michigan School Health Associations 1946-1949
American and Michigan School Health Associations 1946-1949
Michigan Department of Health, Michigan Waterworks newsletters 1950-1954
Children's Fund of Michigan, Dental Division 1930-1953

scopecontent.p: The largest series, Children's Fund of Michigan, Dental Division, documents Gibson's two decades as director of the division. Administrative records in this series include annual reports and activity summaries for the division, forms used in the administration of dental programs, and Gibson's copies of several Children's Fund and Child Health Division reports. The Dental Division series also includes Gibson's incoming and outgoing correspondence with program staff, public health officials, vendors of equipment and supplies, and fellow dental practitioners and educators. Notable in this series are program reports kept by month and by county for the regular dental program and the Summer Dental Relief Program. These reports provide detailed information about the population of children receiving services, locations of clinics, and the interactions between the program staff and local public health officials and educators. There are also reports and correspondence related to several Detroit-area dental programs operated by the division. Finally, the series contains Gibson's files on dental education and research, including articles and lectures on dental practice and post-graduate education; and papers of several sections of the division's Dental Study Club.

scopecontent.p: The Children's Fund of Michigan, Child Health Division series includes annual reports and activity summaries, monthly reports, budgets and financial statements, records of the Fund's eye program, and reports and correspondence related to the Central and Northern Michigan Children's Clinics. This series documents Gibson's years as director of the Child Health Division, but it also includes earlier reports, financial information, and a small amount of the correspondence of his predecessor, Dr. Bernard W. Carey.

did.unittitle: Dr. Carey's memos, reports, and bulletins 1943-1945
Central Michigan Children's Clinic annual reports 1940-1942
Central and Northern Michigan Children's Clinics monthly reports 1947-1949

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The researcher should also consult the Children's Fund of Michigan records available at the Bentley Historical Library and the papers of others associated with the Fund, especially Icie Gertrude Macy Hoobler and William J. Norton.
